snippet: New York City’s Board of Elections said it wanted the extra week to determine the Sept. 10 primary results and prepare for the runoff.
abstract: New York State Legislature appears poised to postpone runoff election for New York City mayoral primary by a week, adding yet another wrinkle to a wide-open campaign to succeed Michael R Bloomberg; lawmakers are considering new date as part of bill to let city's Board of Elections use its old lever voting machines instead of electronic voting machines.

byline.original: By KATE TAYLOR and THOMAS KAPLAN

lead_paragraph: New York City’s Board of Elections said it wanted the extra week to determine the Sept. 10 primary results and prepare for the runoff.

headline.seo: Runoff Elections for Mayor Likely to Be Moved to Oct. 1
headline.main: Legislature Appears Set to Delay Date for Primary Runoffs in Mayoral Race
headline.print_headline: Legislature Appears Set to Delay Date for Primary Runoffs in Mayoral Race
